subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Alphabetical Order
msgSnippet: ... cot/caught, tot/taught, bot/bought, sod/sawed, hock/hawk, Don/Dawn, body/bawdy, clod/clawed, dotter/daughter, bobble/bauble, col/caul, and certainly lots
messageBody:
Paul Tremblay scripsit:

> But to be fair to Moira, that still means she has to give up a phoneme.
> What words would lose their distinction, Moira, if you had to use Awl
> for both On and Awl?

cot/caught, tot/taught, bot/bought, sod/sawed, hock/hawk, Don/Dawn,
body/bawdy, clod/clawed, dotter/daughter, bobble/bauble, col/caul,
and certainly lots more. (Easy for me: the first are LOT, the second
THOUGHT, which are merged with PALM and CLOTH.)

BTW, I found an inconsistency in cmudict here: "thought" has AO, but
"bought" has AA, showing a partial THOUGHT = PALM merger.


--
So that's the tune they play on John Cowan
their fascist banjos, is it? cowan@...
--Great-Souled Sam http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
